Welcome, Steven.  Looking forward to hearing more from you.

Jim



  Greetings everyone,

  I am new to the forum here, at least as a contributor...  I 
  have "lurked" here for some time, and finally decided it was time I 
  joined you all in your excellent discussions.  As a "tsuba man," I 
  have especially appreciated the recent activity on this site.  You 
  are all so knowledgeable and generous with your thoughts and 
  comments---it certainly helps someone like me who is relatively new 
  to tsuba.  

  I have very much enjoyed the Kantei of recent days, and the 
  excellent photographs of tekkotsu that Jim has provided.  It really 
  helps to have such images for reference.  

  Fascinating thoughts, too, on the matter of aesthetic valuation of 
  tsuba in pre-Edo times.  Jim's refereces to the tea ware of the day 
  are intriguing as well.  

  Anyway, I just wanted to introduce myself and express my 
  appreciation for the great activity on the board.  I will look 
  forward to seeing more, and to contributing a few words here and 
  there.  Best to all...

  Steven
